text: Instructions: In this tab, you will find several questions. To answer the questions, drag each tile by its 6 dots into your workspace. Once in your workspace, the tiles will become editable. Wait until your teacher reaches the slide before you answer the the question.

(Slide 14) Question 1

List at least 3 assumptions made by the modeler to simplify the question about the students at South City High School.

(Slide 17) Question 2

(Slide 20) Question 3

Use the [v=] button in the toolbar to create the variable chips that your assigned friend could use to build their model. Use the information provided to you in your handout to help you set the values for these variables.

(Slide 20) Question 4

Compare your variable chips with a partner. Find a variable for which the two friends did NOT agree on the value. In the space below, describe the variable AND why the friends did not assign it the same value.

  • {Describe the variable here}
  • {Explain here why the friends set it to a different value}

(Slide 22) Exit Ticket

What is the purpose for making assumptions when solving a math modeling problem?
